XPS Dash : An alternate dash app with modern UI¶

xps_dash.CONFIG: dict = {'displaylogo': False, 'modeBarButtonsToRemove': ['select2d', 'lasso2d'], 'scrollZoom': True, 'toImageButtonOptions': {'filename': 'custom_image', 'format': 'svg', 'scale': 1}}¶

Dictionary describing the configuration of the plotly Figure object.

class xps_dash.DataBackend[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for the GUI backend.

Methods

connectLabJack:

Connect to the Labjack U6 device.

bindingEnergyToVolt:

Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.

setSpiVoltage:

Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.

startMeasurement:

Start the measurement process.

runSingleMeasurement:

Run a single measurement.

runBatchMeasurement:

Run a batch measurement.

saveMeasurementData:

Save the measurement data to a CSV file.

interruptionClicked:

Handle the interruption of the measurement.

onClose:

Method fired when the close button is clicked.
BATCH_END_EV = 1¶

Index of the end energy value in the batch input table.

BATCH_PASSES = 4¶

Index of the number of passes value in the batch input table.

BATCH_START_EV = 0¶

Index of the start energy value in the batch input table.

BATCH_STEP_EV = 2¶

Index of the step energy value in the batch input table.

BATCH_TIME_PER_STEP = 3¶

Index of the time per step value in the batch input table.

DEP_PATH = '.\\src\\dependencies\\'¶

Path for all the files that the program requires to function.

EXCITATION_AL = 1486.6¶

The excitation energy for Aluminium cathode.

EXCITATION_MG = 1253.6¶

The excitation energy for Magnesium cathode.

U6_CLK_PIN_NUM = 1¶

The CLK pin number for the Labjack U6.

U6_CS_PIN_NUM = 3¶

The CS pin number for the Labjack U6.

U6_MISO_PIN_NUM = 4¶

The MISO pin number for the Labjack U6.

U6_MOSI_PIN_NUM = 2¶

The MOSI pin number for the Labjack U6.

batch_pass_no: int = 1¶

Integer holding the current pass number during a batch measurement.

batch_step_no: int = 1¶

Integer holding the current step number during a batch measurement.

bindingEnergyToVolt(binding_energy: float) → float[source]¶

Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.

Parameters:
binding_energyfloat

The binding energy value.

Returns:
float

The voltage value for the MAX5216 DAC.

connectLabjack() → None[source]¶

Connect to the Labjack U6 device.

current_binding_energy: float = 0¶

Variable holding the value of the current binding energy of the measurement.

current_kinetic_energy: float = 0¶

Variable holding the current kinetic energy of the measurement.

current_progress: int = 0¶

Integer indicating the current progress percentage of the measurement.

data_table: DataFrame¶

Polars DataFrame to store the measurement data.

elapsed_time: float = 0¶

Variable with the elapsed time of the measurement in minutes.

excitation_voltage: float¶

Selected excitation voltage for the measurement.

interruptionClicked() → None[source]¶

Handle the interruption of the measurement.

labjack_connect: bool¶

Boolean to check if the Labjack is connected.

meas_completed: bool = False¶

Boolean indicating if a measurement is completed.

meas_interrupt_id: int¶

ID of the button that was clicked to interrupt the measurement.

meas_interrupted: bool = False¶

Boolean to check if the measurement was interrupted.

meas_running: bool = False¶

Boolean to check if the measurement is running.

measurement_thread: Thread¶

Thread object to run the measurement.

onClose() → None[source]¶

Method fired when the Shutdown App button is clicked.

pass_row_indexes: list¶

List of row indices indicating start of new passes.

plot_fig: Figure¶

Plotly figure object to plot the measurement data.

plot_file_name: str¶

HTML plot file name.

remaining_time: float = 0¶

Variable with the remaining time for the measurement in minutes.

runBatchMeasurement(batch_dataframe: DataFrame) → None[source]¶

Run a batch measurement.

Parameters:
batch_dataframepandas.DataFrame

The pandas Dataframe with the measurement parameters from the batch mode grid.

runSingleMeasurement(start_ev: float, end_ev: float, step_ev: float, time_per_step: float, pass_no: int, batch_no: int, batch_pass_no: int, type_batch=False) → None[source]¶

Run a single measurement.

Parameters:
start_evfloat

The starting energy value for the measurement in eV.

end_evfloat

The ending energy value for the measurement in eV.

step_evfloat

The step width for the measurement in eV.

time_per_stepfloat

The time per step for the measurement in s.

pass_noint

The number of passes for the measurement.

batch_noint

The current batch number of the measurement if in batch mode.

batch_pass_noint

The current pass no. of the meaasurement if in batch mode.

type_batchbool

The type of measurement. True for batch measurement, False for single measurement, by default False.

saveMeasurementData(filename: str = 'xps_data') → None[source]¶

Save the measurement data to a CSV file.

Parameters:
filenamestr, optional

File name to save the results and plot as, by default “xps_data”

setSpiVoltage(volt: float) → None[source]¶

Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.

Parameters:
voltfloat

The voltage value to set at the MAX5216 DAC.

setpoint_ev: float¶

Duplicate variable for the current binding energy of the measurement.

startMeasurement(start_ev: float, end_ev: float, step_ev: float, time_per_step: float, pass_no: int, batch_dataframe: DataFrame, source_mg: bool, batch_mode: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Start the measurement process.

Parameters:
start_evfloat

The start value for the binding energy in the single mode measurement in eV.

end_evfloat

The end value of the binding energy in the single mode measurement in eV.

step_evfloat

The step increment value to be used in the single mode measurement in eV.

time_per_stepfloat

The time to wait per step during the single mode measurement in s.

pass_noint

The no. of passes to be measured during a single mode measurement.

batch_dataframepandas.DataFrame

The pandas Dataframe formed from the dat in the batch mode grid.

source_mgbool

Boolean indicating if the source of the X-ray excitation is Mg.

batch_modebool, optional

Boolean indicating if the measurement is a batch mode measurement, by default False

total_batch_passes: int = 0¶

Integer holding the total number of passes during the batch mode measurement.

total_steps: int = 0¶

Integer indicating the total number of steps in the measurement.

typ_schema: dict¶

Dictionary indicating the scheme for the types in the polars dataframe.

u6_labjack: U6¶

Lajack U6 object for the measurement.

xps_dash.THEMES: list = ['bootstrap', 'cerulean', 'cosmo', 'cyborg', 'darkly', 'flatly', 'journal', 'litera', 'lumen', 'lux', 'materia', 'minty', 'morph', 'pulse', 'quartz', 'sandstone', 'simplex', 'sketchy', 'slate', 'solar', 'spacelab', 'superhero', 'united', 'vapor', 'yeti', 'zephyr']¶

List of theme names for the dash app.

xps_dash.addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(fig: Figure, pass_index: int, x_data: Series, y_data: Series, trace_name: str) → Figure[source]¶

Method to add or update traces in the plotly Figure object. To be used whenever a new point is obtained from the instrument.

Parameters:
figplotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly Figure object in which the traces are to be added or updated.

pass_indexint

Integer indicating the index of the trace to be added or updated.

x_datapandas.Series

The data for the x-coordinate of the trace points.

y_datapandas.Series

The data for the y-coordinate of the trace points.

trace_namestr

The name of the trace to be added or updated.

Returns:
plotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly Figure object returned after adding or updating the trace.

xps_dash.addPlotRefLines(fig: Figure) → Figure[source]¶

Method to add reference photoelectron spectral lines to the plot figure.

Parameters:
figplotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly graph object in which plot reference lines are to be added.

Returns:
plotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly Figure object after adding the reference lines.

The dash app variable.

 102def reset_fig(theme_dark: bool = False, batch_mode: bool = False) -> go.Figure:
 103    """Method to create blank plot figure.
 104
 105    Parameters
 106    ----------
 107    theme_dark : bool, optional
 108        Boolean indicating if the figure has to use a dark theme template, by default False
 109    batch_mode : bool, optional
 110        Boolean indicating if the measurement type is a batch mode measurement, by default False
 111
 112    Returns
 113    -------
 114    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 115        The plotly figure object.
 116    """
 117    trace_name = "pass_1"
 118    if batch_mode:
 119        trace_name = "b1_pass_1"
 120    fig = go.Figure(
 121        data=[go.Scatter(x=[], y=[], mode="markers+lines", line_width=1, marker_size=4, name=trace_name)],
 122        layout=go.Layout(
 123            **LAYOUT,
 124            xaxis_title="Binding Energy [eV]",
 125            yaxis_title="Counts",
 126            uirevision="no_change",
 127            legend={
 128                "orientation": "h",
 129                "xanchor": "center",
 130                "x": 0.5,
 131            },
 132        ),
 133    )
 134
 135    fig = addPlotRefLines(fig)
 136
 137    if theme_dark:
 138        fig.update_layout(dict(template=BOOTSTRAP_DARK))
 139        fig = updateRefLinesTheme(fig, True)
 140
 141    return fig
 142
 143
 144def addPlotRefLines(fig: go.Figure) -> go.Figure:
 145    """Method to add reference photoelectron spectral lines to the plot figure.
 146
 147    Parameters
 148    ----------
 149    fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 150        The plotly graph object in which plot reference lines are to be added.
 151
 152    Returns
 153    -------
 154    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 155        The plotly Figure object after adding the reference lines.
 156    """
 157    fig.add_vline(
 158        x=83.95,
 159        line=dict(
 160            color="#B3DF72",
 161            width=3,
 162            dash="dash",
 163        ),
 164        opacity=0.6,
 165        name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{7/2}$",
 166        showlegend=True,
 167    )
 168    fig.add_vline(
 169        x=87.9,
 170        line=dict(
 171            color="#FD9891",
 172            width=3,
 173            dash="dash",
 174        ),
 175        opacity=0.6,
 176        name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{5/2}$",
 177        showlegend=True,
 178    )
 179    fig.add_vline(
 180        x=284.4,
 181        line=dict(
 182            color="#FEC195",
 183            width=3,
 184            dash="dash",
 185        ),
 186        opacity=0.6,
 187        name=r"$\large \text{C 1s}$",
 188        showlegend=True,
 189    )
 190    fig.add_vline(
 191        x=72.84,
 192        line=dict(
 193            color="#F5CD47",
 194            width=3,
 195            dash="dash",
 196        ),
 197        opacity=0.6,
 198        name=r"$\large \text{Al 2p}_\text{3/2}$",
 199        showlegend=True,
 200    )
 201    fig.add_vline(
 202        x=532.70,
 203        line=dict(
 204            color="#7EE2B8",
 205            width=3,
 206            dash="dash",
 207        ),
 208        opacity=0.6,
 209        name=r"$\large \text{O 1s}$",
 210        showlegend=True,
 211    )
 212    fig.add_vline(
 213        x=118,
 214        line=dict(
 215            color="#9DD9EE",
 216            width=3,
 217            dash="dash",
 218        ),
 219        opacity=0.6,
 220        name=r"$\large \text{Al 2s}$",
 221        showlegend=True,
 222    )
 223
 224    return fig
 225
 226
 227def updateRefLinesTheme(fig: go.Figure, dark_theme: bool = False):
 228    """Method to change the colors of the reference lines when the theme template is changed in the plotly Fgiure between dark and light.
 229
 230    Parameters
 231    ----------
 232    fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 233        The plotly Figure object in which the reference lines exist.
 234    dark_theme : bool, optional
 235        Boolean indicating if the dark theme template of the Figure is on., by default False
 236
 237    Returns
 238    -------
 239    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 240        The plotly Figure object with the updated colors of the reference lines.
 241    """
 242    if dark_theme:
 243        fig.update_traces(
 244            overwrite=False,
 245            line=dict(
 246                color="#B3DF72",
 247            ),
 248            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{7/2}$"),
 249        )
 250        fig.update_traces(
 251            overwrite=False,
 252            line=dict(
 253                color="#FD9891",
 254            ),
 255            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{5/2}$"),
 256        )
 257        fig.update_traces(
 258            overwrite=False,
 259            line=dict(
 260                color="#FEC195",
 261            ),
 262            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{C 1s}$"),
 263        )
 264        fig.update_traces(
 265            overwrite=False,
 266            line=dict(
 267                color="#F5CD47",
 268            ),
 269            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Al 2p}_\text{3/2}$"),
 270        )
 271        fig.update_traces(
 272            overwrite=False,
 273            line=dict(
 274                color="#7EE2B8",
 275            ),
 276            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{O 1s}$"),
 277        )
 278        fig.update_traces(
 279            overwrite=False,
 280            line=dict(
 281                color="#9DD9EE",
 282            ),
 283            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Al 2s}$"),
 284        )
 285    else:
 286        fig.update_traces(
 287            overwrite=False,
 288            line=dict(
 289                color="#5B7F24",
 290            ),
 291            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{7/2}$"),
 292        )
 293        fig.update_traces(
 294            overwrite=False,
 295            line=dict(
 296                color="#C9372C",
 297            ),
 298            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{5/2}$"),
 299        )
 300        fig.update_traces(
 301            overwrite=False,
 302            line=dict(
 303                color="#C25100",
 304            ),
 305            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{C 1s}$"),
 306        )
 307        fig.update_traces(
 308            overwrite=False,
 309            line=dict(
 310                color="#946F00",
 311            ),
 312            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Al 2p}_\text{3/2}$"),
 313        )
 314        fig.update_traces(
 315            overwrite=False,
 316            line=dict(
 317                color="#1F845A",
 318            ),
 319            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{O 1s}$"),
 320        )
 321        fig.update_traces(
 322            overwrite=False,
 323            line=dict(
 324                color="#227D9B",
 325            ),
 326            selector=dict(name=r"$\large \text{Al 2s}$"),
 327        )
 328
 329    return fig
 330
 331
 332def addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(
 333    fig: go.Figure, pass_index: int, x_data: pd.Series, y_data: pd.Series, trace_name: str
 334) -> go.Figure:
 335    """Method to add or update traces in the plotly Figure object. To be used whenever a new point is obtained from the instrument.
 336
 337    Parameters
 338    ----------
 339    fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 340        The plotly Figure object in which the traces are to be added or updated.
 341    pass_index : int
 342        Integer indicating the index of the trace to be added or updated.
 343    x_data : pandas.Series
 344        The data for the x-coordinate of the trace points.
 345    y_data : pandas.Series
 346        The data for the y-coordinate of the trace points.
 347    trace_name : str
 348        The name of the trace to be added or updated.
 349
 350    Returns
 351    -------
 352    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 353        The plotly Figure object returned after adding or updating the trace.
 354    """
 355    existing_passes = len(fig["data"])
 356    if existing_passes < pass_index:
 357        fig.add_trace(
 358            go.Scatter(
 359                x=x_data,
 360                y=y_data,
 361                mode="markers+lines",
 362                line_width=1,
 363                marker_size=4,
 364                name=trace_name,
 365            )
 366        )
 367    fig.update_traces(
 368        overwrite=False,
 369        x=x_data,
 370        y=y_data,
 371        selector=dict(name=trace_name),
 372    )
 373
 374    return fig
 375
 376
 377class DataBackend:
 378    """Class for the GUI backend.
 379
 380    Methods
 381    -------
 382    connectLabJack:
 383        Connect to the Labjack U6 device.
 384    bindingEnergyToVolt:
 385        Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.
 386    setSpiVoltage:
 387        Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.
 388    startMeasurement:
 389        Start the measurement process.
 390    runSingleMeasurement:
 391        Run a single measurement.
 392    runBatchMeasurement:
 393        Run a batch measurement.
 394    saveMeasurementData:
 395        Save the measurement data to a CSV file.
 396    interruptionClicked:
 397        Handle the interruption of the measurement.
 398    onClose:
 399        Method fired when the close button is clicked.
 400    """
 401
 402    BATCH_START_EV = 0
 403    """Index of the start energy value in the batch input table."""
 404    BATCH_END_EV = 1
 405    """Index of the end energy value in the batch input table."""
 406    BATCH_STEP_EV = 2
 407    """Index of the step energy value in the batch input table."""
 408    BATCH_TIME_PER_STEP = 3
 409    """Index of the time per step value in the batch input table."""
 410    BATCH_PASSES = 4
 411    """Index of the number of passes value in the batch input table."""
 412    EXCITATION_AL = 1486.6
 413    """The excitation energy for Aluminium cathode."""
 414    EXCITATION_MG = 1253.6
 415    """The excitation energy for Magnesium cathode."""
 416    U6_MOSI_PIN_NUM = 2
 417    """The MOSI pin number for the Labjack U6."""
 418    U6_MISO_PIN_NUM = 4
 419    """The MISO pin number for the Labjack U6."""
 420    U6_CLK_PIN_NUM = 1
 421    """The CLK pin number for the Labjack U6."""
 422    U6_CS_PIN_NUM = 3
 423    """The CS pin number for the Labjack U6."""
 424    DEP_PATH = ".\\src\\dependencies\\"
 425    """Path for all the files that the program requires to function."""
 426
 427    u6_labjack: u6.U6
 428    """Lajack U6 object for the measurement."""
 429    labjack_connect: bool
 430    """Boolean to check if the Labjack is connected."""
 431    data_table: pl.DataFrame
 432    """Polars DataFrame to store the measurement data."""
 433    pass_row_indexes: list
 434    """List of row indices indicating start of new passes."""
 435    typ_schema: dict
 436    """Dictionary indicating the scheme for the types in the polars dataframe."""
 437    measurement_thread: threading.Thread
 438    """Thread object to run the measurement."""
 439    excitation_voltage: float
 440    """Selected excitation voltage for the measurement."""
 441    plot_fig: go.Figure
 442    """Plotly figure object to plot the measurement data."""
 443    plot_file_name: str
 444    """HTML plot file name."""
 445    meas_interrupted: bool = False
 446    """Boolean to check if the measurement was interrupted."""
 447    meas_interrupt_id: int
 448    """ID of the button that was clicked to interrupt the measurement."""
 449    meas_running: bool = False
 450    """Boolean to check if the measurement is running."""
 451    current_binding_energy: float = 0
 452    """Variable holding the value of the current binding energy of the measurement."""
 453    current_kinetic_energy: float = 0
 454    """Variable holding the current kinetic energy of the measurement."""
 455    setpoint_ev: float
 456    """Duplicate variable for the current binding energy of the measurement."""
 457    current_progress: int = 0
 458    """Integer indicating the current progress percentage of the measurement."""
 459    remaining_time: float = 0
 460    """Variable with the remaining time for the measurement in minutes."""
 461    elapsed_time: float = 0
 462    """Variable with the elapsed time of the measurement in minutes."""
 463    total_steps: int = 0
 464    """Integer indicating the total number of steps in the measurement."""
 465    total_batch_passes: int = 0
 466    """Integer holding the total number of passes during the batch mode measurement."""
 467    batch_pass_no: int = 1
 468    """Integer holding the current pass number during a batch measurement."""
 469    batch_step_no: int = 1
 470    """Integer holding the current step number during a batch measurement."""
 471    meas_completed: bool = False
 472    """Boolean indicating if a measurement is completed."""
 473
 474    def __init__(self) -> None:
 475        """
 476        Initialize the main window of the program.
 477
 478        """
 479        self.connectLabjack()
 480        self.plot_fig = reset_fig()
 481
 482        self.plot_file_name = "".join([os.getcwd(), "\\src\\dependencies\\", "plt_dat.html"])
 483
 484    def connectLabjack(self) -> None:
 485        """Connect to the Labjack U6 device."""
 486        self.u6_labjack = u6.U6()
 487        self.u6_labjack.getCalibrationData()
 488        self.u6_labjack.configIO(EnableCounter0=True)
 489        # ljud.eDAC(self.u6_labjack, 1, 3)  # Set the reference voltage for the MAX5216 DAC
 490        self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.DAC1_8(self.u6_labjack.voltageToDACBits(3, 1)))
 491        self.labjack_connect = True
 492
 493    def bindingEnergyToVolt(self, binding_energy: float) -> float:
 494        """Convert the binding energy to voltage for the MAX5216 DAC.
 495
 496        Parameters
 497        ----------
 498        binding_energy : float
 499            The binding energy value.
 500
 501        Returns
 502        -------
 503        float
 504            The voltage value for the MAX5216 DAC.
 505
 506        """
 507        self.setpoint_ev = binding_energy
 508        kinetic_energy = self.excitation_voltage - binding_energy
 509        self.current_binding_energy = binding_energy
 510        self.current_kinetic_energy = kinetic_energy
 511        return kinetic_energy / 498.43
 512
 513    def setSpiVoltage(self, volt: float) -> None:
 514        """Set the voltage at the MAX5216 DAC.
 515
 516        Parameters
 517        ----------
 518        volt : float
 519            The voltage value to set at the MAX5216 DAC.
 520
 521        """
 522        ref_volt_at_MAX5216_DAC = self.u6_labjack.getAIN(3)  # the reference voltage at the DAC MAX5216
 523        volt_bits = int(
 524            volt * 65535 / ref_volt_at_MAX5216_DAC
 525        )  # convert input volts to a 16 bit scaled value with the reference voltage
 526        volt_bits = (
 527            volt_bits << 6
 528        )  # shift the 16 bit value 6 bits to the left to make it a 22 bit value. Refer to MAX5216 datasheet
 529        volt_bits |= (
 530            1 << 22
 531        )  # set the 23rd bit to 1 to indicate that the first 2 bits are the command bits. Refer to MAX5216 datasheet
 532        self.u6_labjack.spi(
 533            list(volt_bits.to_bytes(3)),
 534            CSPINNum=self.U6_CS_PIN_NUM,
 535            CLKPinNum=self.U6_CLK_PIN_NUM,
 536            MISOPinNum=self.U6_MISO_PIN_NUM,
 537            MOSIPinNum=self.U6_MOSI_PIN_NUM,
 538        )
 539        # Set the voltage at DAC0 of the Labjack for comparison with MAX5216.
 540        self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.DAC0_8(self.u6_labjack.voltageToDACBits(volt, 0)))
 541
 542    def startMeasurement(
 543        self,
 544        start_ev: float,
 545        end_ev: float,
 546        step_ev: float,
 547        time_per_step: float,
 548        pass_no: int,
 549        batch_dataframe: pd.DataFrame,
 550        source_mg: bool,
 551        batch_mode: bool = False,
 552    ) -> None:
 553        """Start the measurement process.
 554
 555        Parameters
 556        ----------
 557        start_ev : float
 558            The start value for the binding energy in the single mode measurement in eV.
 559        end_ev : float
 560            The end value of the binding energy in the single mode measurement in eV.
 561        step_ev : float
 562            The step increment value to be used in the single mode measurement in eV.
 563        time_per_step : float
 564            The time to wait per step during the single mode measurement in s.
 565        pass_no : int
 566            The no. of passes to be measured during a single mode measurement.
 567        batch_dataframe : pandas.DataFrame
 568            The pandas Dataframe formed from the dat in the batch mode grid.
 569        source_mg : bool
 570            Boolean indicating if the source of the X-ray excitation is Mg.
 571        batch_mode : bool, optional
 572            Boolean indicating if the measurement is a batch mode measurement, by default False
 573        """
 574        self.total_steps = 0
 575        self.total_batch_passes = 0
 576        self.batch_pass_no = 1
 577        self.batch_step_no = 1
 578        if source_mg:
 579            self.excitation_voltage = self.EXCITATION_MG
 580        else:
 581            self.excitation_voltage = self.EXCITATION_AL
 582
 583        if batch_mode:
 584            # if Batch Scan tab is selected in the UI. Batch scan mode is 1. Single scan mode is 0.
 585
 586            total_time_s = 0
 587
 588            for row_index in range(0, len(batch_dataframe)):
 589                batch_time = 0
 590                start_ev = batch_dataframe["Start [eV]"][row_index]
 591                end_ev = batch_dataframe["End [eV]"][row_index]
 592                step_ev = batch_dataframe["Step [eV]"][row_index]
 593                time_per_step = batch_dataframe["Time [s/eV]"][row_index]
 594                pass_no = batch_dataframe["Passes"][row_index]
 595                if math.isnan(start_ev):
 596                    break
 597                batch_time = (time_per_step) * (pass_no) * ((end_ev - start_ev) / step_ev + 1)
 598                total_time_s += batch_time
 599                self.total_steps += int((end_ev - start_ev) / step_ev + 1) * pass_no
 600                self.total_batch_passes += pass_no
 601
 602            self.elapsed_time = 0
 603            self.remaining_time = round(total_time_s / 60, 2)
 604            self.current_progress = 0
 605            self.measurement_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.runBatchMeasurement, args=[batch_dataframe])
 606            self.plot_fig = reset_fig(batch_mode=True)
 607        else:
 608            self.total_steps = int(abs((end_ev - start_ev) / step_ev + 1) * pass_no)
 609            total_time_s = time_per_step * pass_no * ((end_ev - start_ev) / step_ev + 1)
 610            self.remaining_time = round(total_time_s / 60, 2)
 611            self.elapsed_time = 0
 612            self.current_progress = 0
 613
 614            self.measurement_thread = threading.Thread(
 615                target=self.runSingleMeasurement,
 616                args=[start_ev, end_ev, step_ev, time_per_step, pass_no, 0, 0, False],
 617            )
 618            self.plot_fig = reset_fig()
 619
 620        self.typ_schema = {
 621            "Binding Energy [eV]": pl.Float64,
 622            "Pass No.": pl.Float64,
 623            "Time_per_step [s]": pl.Float64,
 624            "Counts": pl.Float64,
 625            "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": pl.Float64,
 626            "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": pl.Float64,
 627            "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": pl.Float64,
 628        }
 629        data_temp = {
 630            "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
 631            "Pass No.": [],
 632            "Time_per_step [s]": [],
 633            "Counts": [],
 634            "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": [],
 635            "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": [],
 636            "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": [],
 637        }
 638
 639        self.data_table = pl.DataFrame(
 640            data_temp,
 641            schema=self.typ_schema,
 642        )
 643
 644        self.meas_running = True
 645        self.meas_completed = False
 646        self.meas_interrupted = False
 647
 648        self.measurement_thread.start()
 649
 650    def runSingleMeasurement(
 651        self,
 652        start_ev: float,
 653        end_ev: float,
 654        step_ev: float,
 655        time_per_step: float,
 656        pass_no: int,
 657        batch_no: int,
 658        batch_pass_no: int,
 659        type_batch=False,
 660    ) -> None:
 661        """Run a single measurement.
 662
 663        Parameters
 664        ----------
 665        start_ev : float
 666            The starting energy value for the measurement in eV.
 667        end_ev : float
 668            The ending energy value for the measurement in eV.
 669        step_ev : float
 670            The step width for the measurement in eV.
 671        time_per_step : float
 672            The time per step for the measurement in s.
 673        pass_no : int
 674            The number of passes for the measurement.
 675        batch_no : int
 676            The current batch number of the measurement if in batch mode.
 677        batch_pass_no : int
 678            The current pass no. of the meaasurement if in batch mode.
 679        type_batch : bool
 680            The type of measurement. True for batch measurement, False for single measurement, by default False.
 681
 682        """
 683        self.setSpiVoltage(self.bindingEnergyToVolt(start_ev))
 684
 685        pass_index = 1
 686
 687        plot_dataframe = pd.DataFrame({
 688            "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
 689            "Counts": [],
 690        })
 691
 692        step_no = 1
 693
 694        while pass_index <= pass_no:
 695            self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.Counter0(True))
 696            start_time = time.time()
 697            __refresh_time = 0
 698            while __refresh_time <= time_per_step:
 699                if self.meas_interrupted:
 700                    break
 701                if __refresh_time + 1 < time_per_step:
 702                    time.sleep(1)
 703                    __refresh_time += 1
 704                else:
 705                    time.sleep(time_per_step - __refresh_time)
 706                    break
 707
 708            if self.meas_interrupted:
 709                self.meas_interrupted = False
 710                self.meas_completed = True
 711                self.meas_running = False
 712                self.current_progress = 100
 713                time.sleep(1)
 714                return
 715            counts = self.u6_labjack.getFeedback(u6.Counter0(False))[0]
 716            time_taken = time.time() - start_time  # record in s
 717            binding_energy = self.setpoint_ev
 718            counts_per_milli = round(counts / (time_taken * 1000), 6)
 719            u6_dac0_voltage = round(self.u6_labjack.getAIN(0), 6)
 720            max5216_dac_voltage = round(self.u6_labjack.getAIN(2), 6)
 721
 722            new_data = {
 723                "Binding Energy [eV]": binding_energy,
 724                "Pass No.": pass_index,
 725                "Time_per_step [s]": time_taken,
 726                "Counts": counts,
 727                "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": counts_per_milli,
 728                "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": u6_dac0_voltage,
 729                "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": max5216_dac_voltage,
 730            }
 731
 732            new_plot_point = pd.DataFrame({
 733                "Binding Energy [eV]": [binding_energy],
 734                "Counts": [counts],
 735            })
 736
 737            plot_dataframe = pd.concat([plot_dataframe, new_plot_point])
 738
 739            new_df = pl.DataFrame(new_data, schema=self.typ_schema)
 740            self.data_table = pl.concat([self.data_table, new_df])
 741            if not type_batch:
 742                self.plot_fig = addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(
 743                    self.plot_fig,
 744                    pass_index,
 745                    plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
 746                    plot_dataframe["Counts"],
 747                    f"pass_{pass_index}",
 748                )
 749            else:
 750                self.plot_fig = addOrUpdatePlotTraceData(
 751                    self.plot_fig,
 752                    self.batch_pass_no,
 753                    plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
 754                    plot_dataframe["Counts"],
 755                    f"b{batch_no}_pass_{pass_index}",
 756                )
 757            # if not type_batch:
 758            #     if existing_passes < pass_index:
 759            #         self.plot_fig.add_trace(
 760            #             go.Scatter(
 761            #                 x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
 762            #                 y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
 763            #                 mode="markers+lines",
 764            #                 line_width=1,
 765            #                 marker_size=4,
 766            #                 name=f"pass_{pass_index}",
 767            #             )
 768            #         )
 769            #     self.plot_fig.update_traces(
 770            #         overwrite=False,
 771            #         x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
 772            #         y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
 773            #         selector=dict(name=f"pass_{pass_index}"),
 774            #     )
 775            # else:
 776            #     if existing_passes < self.batch_pass_no:
 777            #         self.plot_fig.add_trace(
 778            #             go.Scatter(
 779            #                 x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
 780            #                 y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
 781            #                 mode="markers+lines",
 782            #                 line_width=1,
 783            #                 marker_size=4,
 784            #                 name=f"b{batch_no}_pass_{pass_index}",
 785            #             )
 786            #         )
 787            #     self.plot_fig.update_traces(
 788            #         overwrite=False,
 789            #         x=plot_dataframe["Binding Energy [eV]"],
 790            #         y=plot_dataframe["Counts"],
 791            #         selector=dict(name=f"b{batch_no}_pass_{pass_index}"),
 792            #     )
 793            self.plot_fig.write_html(
 794                self.plot_file_name,
 795                config=CONFIG,
 796                include_plotlyjs="cdn",
 797                include_mathjax="cdn",
 798            )
 799
 800            if type_batch:
 801                step_no = self.batch_step_no
 802            self.current_progress = int(step_no * 100 / self.total_steps)
 803            self.remaining_time -= time_taken / 60
 804            self.elapsed_time += time_taken / 60
 805
 806            if self.setpoint_ev + step_ev <= end_ev:
 807                self.setpoint_ev += step_ev
 808                step_no += 1
 809                if type_batch:
 810                    self.batch_step_no += 1
 811                self.setSpiVoltage(self.bindingEnergyToVolt(self.setpoint_ev))
 812            else:
 813                self.setSpiVoltage(self.bindingEnergyToVolt(start_ev))
 814                pass_index += 1
 815                if type_batch:
 816                    self.batch_pass_no += 1
 817                    self.batch_step_no += 1
 818                plot_dataframe = pd.DataFrame({
 819                    "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
 820                    "Counts": [],
 821                })
 822
 823        if not type_batch:
 824            self.current_progress = 100
 825            self.remaining_time = 0.0
 826            time.sleep(1)
 827            self.meas_completed = True
 828            self.meas_running = False
 829
 830    def runBatchMeasurement(self, batch_dataframe: pd.DataFrame) -> None:
 831        """Run a batch measurement.
 832
 833        Parameters
 834        ----------
 835        batch_dataframe : pandas.DataFrame
 836            The pandas Dataframe with the measurement parameters from the batch mode grid.
 837        """
 838        for row_index in range(0, len(batch_dataframe)):
 839            if self.meas_running:
 840                start_ev = batch_dataframe["Start [eV]"][row_index]
 841                end_ev = batch_dataframe["End [eV]"][row_index]
 842                step_ev = batch_dataframe["Step [eV]"][row_index]
 843                time_per_step = batch_dataframe["Time [s/eV]"][row_index]
 844                pass_no = batch_dataframe["Passes"][row_index]
 845                if math.isnan(start_ev):
 846                    break
 847                self.runSingleMeasurement(
 848                    start_ev, end_ev, step_ev, time_per_step, pass_no, row_index + 1, self.batch_pass_no, True
 849                )
 850        self.current_progress = 100
 851        self.remaining_time = 0.0
 852        time.sleep(1)
 853        self.meas_running = False
 854        self.meas_completed = True
 855        self.batch_pass_no = 1
 856        self.batch_step_no = 0
 857        return
 858
 859    def saveMeasurementData(self, filename: str = "xps_data") -> None:
 860        """Save the measurement data to a CSV file.
 861
 862        Parameters
 863        ----------
 864        filename : str, optional
 865            File name to save the results and plot as, by default "xps_data"
 866        """
 867
 868        self.data_table.write_csv(filename + ".csv")
 869
 870        self.current_progress = 100
 871        return
 872
 873    def interruptionClicked(self) -> None:
 874        """Handle the interruption of the measurement."""
 875        self.meas_interrupted = True
 876        self.meas_running = False
 877
 878    def onClose(self) -> None:
 879        """Method fired when the Shutdown App button is clicked."""
 880        os._exit(0)

 969def generate_single_mode_tab_content(
 970    start_ev: float, end_ev: float, ev_step: float, time_step: float, pass_no: int
 971) -> list:
 972    """Method to generate the content for the Dash container when the single mode tab is clicked.
 973
 974    Parameters
 975    ----------
 976    start_ev : float
 977        The start value in eV to be shown in the start eV field of the Dash app.
 978    end_ev : float
 979        The end value in eV to be shown in the end eV field of the Dash app.
 980    ev_step : float
 981        The step value in eV to be shown in the step eV field of the Dash app.
 982    time_step : float
 983        The time per step in s to be shown in the time per step field of the Dash app.
 984    pass_no : int
 985        The pass no. to be shown in the no. of passes field in the Dash app.
 986
 987    Returns
 988    -------
 989    list
 990        A list indicating the child components to be added to the respective Dash container.
 991    """
 992    return [
 993        dbc.Col([
 994            dbc.InputGroup(
 995                [
 996                    dbc.InputGroupText(
 997                        "Start : ",
 998                    ),
 999                    dbc.Input(
1000                        type="number",
1001                        step=0.001,
1002                        id="start-ev",
1003                        value=start_ev,
1004                        min=0.0,
1005                        max=1486.6,
1006                    ),
1007                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1008                        "eV",
1009                    ),
1010                ],
1011            ),
1012            dbc.InputGroup(
1013                [
1014                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1015                        "End : ",
1016                    ),
1017                    dbc.Input(
1018                        type="number",
1019                        step=0.001,
1020                        id="end-ev",
1021                        value=end_ev,
1022                        min=0.001,
1023                        max=1486.6,
1024                    ),
1025                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1026                        "eV",
1027                    ),
1028                ],
1029            ),
1030            dbc.InputGroup(
1031                [
1032                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1033                        "Step width : ",
1034                    ),
1035                    dbc.Input(
1036                        type="number",
1037                        step=0.001,
1038                        id="ev-step",
1039                        value=ev_step,
1040                        min=0.001,
1041                        max=1486.6,
1042                    ),
1043                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1044                        "eV",
1045                    ),
1046                ],
1047            ),
1048            dbc.InputGroup(
1049                [
1050                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1051                        "Time per step : ",
1052                    ),
1053                    dbc.Input(
1054                        type="number",
1055                        step=1.0,
1056                        id="time-step",
1057                        value=time_step,
1058                        min=1.0,
1059                    ),
1060                ],
1061            ),
1062            dbc.InputGroup(
1063                [
1064                    dbc.InputGroupText(
1065                        "No. of passes : ",
1066                    ),
1067                    dbc.Input(
1068                        type="number",
1069                        step=1,
1070                        id="meas-passes",
1071                        value=pass_no,
1072                        min=1,
1073                    ),
1074                ],
1075            ),
1076        ])
1077    ]
1078
1079
1080single_mode_tab_content = generate_single_mode_tab_content(0.0, 1000.0, 0.6, 1.0, 1)
1081"""The Dash content to be shown when the Single mode tab is clicked."""

1087    "End [eV]": [np.nan for i in range(1, 51)],

1097
1098def generate_batch_data_grid(dataframe: pd.DataFrame) -> list:
1099    """Method to generate the content for the Dash container when the batch mode tab is clicked.
1100
1101    Parameters
1102    ----------
1103    dataframe : pandas.DataFrame
1104        The pandas Dataframe with the data for the batch mode grid in the Dash app.
1105
1106    Returns
1107    -------
1108    list
1109        A list with the child entries for the Dash container.
1110    """
1111    return [
1112        dbc.Container(
1113            [
1114                dash_table.DataTable(
1115                    id="batch-seq",
1116                    columns=[
1117                        {
1118                            "name": i,
1119                            "id": i,
1120                            "editable": False if i in " " else True,
1121                            "type": "numeric",
1122                        }
1123                        for i in dataframe.columns
1124                    ],
1125                    data=dataframe.to_dict("records"),
1126                    editable=True,
1127                    fixed_rows={"headers": True},
1128                    # filter_action="native",
1129                    # sort_action="native",
1130                    style_table={
1131                        "overflowX": "auto",
1132                        "overflowY": "auto",
1133                        "border": "1px solid var(--bs-border-color-translucent)",
1134                        "height": "266px",
1135                        "scrollbar-color": "var(--bs-border-color) transparent",
1136                        "scrollbar-width": "thin",
1137                    },
1138                    style_header={
1139                        "border": "1px solid var(--bs-border-color-translucent)",
1140                        "border-top": "0px",
1141                        "background-color": "var(--bs-card-cap-bg)",
1142                        "text-color": "var(--bs-body-color)",
1143                        "whiteSpace": "normal",
1144                        "height": "auto",
1145                        "lineHeight": "18px",
1146                    },
1147                    style_data={
1148                        "border": "1px solid var(--bs-border-color-translucent)",
1149                        "background-color": "var(--bs-body-bg)",
1150                        "text-color": "var(--bs-body-color)",
1151                    },
1152                    style_data_conditional=[
1153                        {
1154                            "if": {
1155                                "state": "active",
1156                            },
1157                            "backgroundColor": "var(--bs-focus-ring-color)",
1158                            "border": "1px solid var(--bs-primary)",
1159                            "text-color": "var(--bs-body-color)",
1160                        },
1161                        {
1162                            "if": {
1163                                "column_id": " ",
1164                            },
1165                            "border-left": "0px",
1166                        },
1167                    ],
1168                    style_cell={
1169                        "textAlign": "center",
1170                        "minWidth": "72px",
1171                        "width": "72px",
1172                        "maxWidth": "72px",
1173                        # "whiteSpace": "normal",
1174                    },
1175                    style_cell_conditional=[
1176                        {
1177                            "if": {
1178                                "column_id": " ",
1179                            },
1180                            "textAlign": "center",
1181                            "minWidth": "30px",
1182                            "width": "30px",
1183                            "maxWidth": "30px",
1184                            # "whiteSpace": "normal",
1185                        }
1186                    ],
1187                ),
1188            ],
1189            class_name="table-container-mod",
1190        )

1453
1454@app.callback(
1455    Output("card-content", "children"),
1456    Output("start-ev-value", "data"),
1457    Output("end-ev-value", "data"),
1458    Output("ev-step-value", "data"),
1459    Output("time-step-value", "data"),
1460    Output("meas-passes-value", "data"),
1461    Output("batch-seq-dataframe", "data"),
1462    Input("card-tabs", "active_tab"),
1463    State("card-content", "children"),
1464    State("start-ev-value", "data"),
1465    State("end-ev-value", "data"),
1466    State("ev-step-value", "data"),
1467    State("time-step-value", "data"),
1468    State("meas-passes-value", "data"),
1469    State("batch-seq-dataframe", "data"),
1470)
1471def tab_content(
1472    active_tab: str,
1473    old_mode: list,
1474    start_ev: float,
1475    end_ev: float,
1476    ev_step: float,
1477    time_step: float,
1478    pass_no: int,
1479    batch_dataframe: dict,
1480) -> tuple[list, float, float, float, float, int, dict | list]:
1481    """Method to update the Dash app content when the tabs are switched between single and batch mode.
1482
1483    Parameters
1484    ----------
1485    active_tab : str
1486        String with the id of the active tab or the tab that was clicked.
1487    old_mode : list
1488        List of children of the Dash container that was rendered before clicking the tab change.
1489    start_ev : float
1490        The start eV value from the Store to be shown in start ev field of the Dash app if the single mode tab was clicked.
1491    end_ev : float
1492        The end eV value from the Store to be shown in end ev field of the Dash app if the single mode tab was clicked.
1493    ev_step : float
1494        The step eV value from the Store to be shown in step ev field of the Dash app if the single mode tab was clicked.
1495    time_step : float
1496        The the time per step value from the Store to be shown in time per step field of the Dash app if the single mode tab was clicked.
1497    pass_no : int
1498        The no. of passes value from the Store to be shown in no. of passes field of the Dash app if the single mode tab was clicked.
1499    batch_dataframe : dict
1500        The dictionary of values from the Store to be shown in the batch data grid if the batch mode tab was clicked.
1501
1502    Returns
1503    -------
1504    tuple[list, float, float, float, float, int, dict]
1505        Returns the list of child entries to be render for the respective active tab, start ev value, end ev value, time per step value, no. of passes value, dictionary with the batch data grid, respectively.
1506    """
1507    if active_tab in "tab-2":
1508        card_content = generate_batch_data_grid(pd.DataFrame(batch_dataframe))
1509        start_ev_mod = old_mode[0]["props"]["children"][0]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1510        end_ev_mod = old_mode[0]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1511        ev_step_mod = old_mode[0]["props"]["children"][2]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1512        time_step_mod = old_mode[0]["props"]["children"][3]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1513        pass_no_mod = old_mode[0]["props"]["children"][4]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1514        return (
1515            card_content,
1516            start_ev_mod,
1517            end_ev_mod,
1518            ev_step_mod,
1519            time_step_mod,
1520            pass_no_mod,
1521            batch_dataframe,
1522        )
1523    else:
1524        batch_dataframe_mod = old_mode[0]["props"]["children"][0]["props"]["data"]
1525        card_content = generate_single_mode_tab_content(start_ev, end_ev, ev_step, time_step, pass_no)
1526        temp_batch_data = pd.DataFrame(batch_dataframe_mod).to_dict("records")
1527        return (
1528            card_content,
1529            start_ev,
1530            end_ev,
1531            ev_step,
1532            time_step,
1533            pass_no,
1534            temp_batch_data,
1535        )
1536
1537
1538# ********************************************************************************
1539
1540
1541@callback(
1542    Output("graph", "figure"),
1543    Input("switch", "value"),
1544    State("graph", "figure"),
1545    # prevent_initial_call=True,
1546)
1547def updateFigureTemplate(switch_on: int, ex_fig: dict) -> go.Figure | Patch:
1548    """Method called to change the theme of the figure when the theme of the app is changed.
1549
1550    Parameters
1551    ----------
1552    switch_on : int
1553        Integer indicating the state of the switch. 0 is OFF and 1 is ON.
1554
1555    Returns
1556    -------
1557    plotly.graph_objects.Figure | dash.Patch
1558        The plotly figure or dash Patch object to be sent to the graph division of the app.
1559
1560    """
1561
1562    # When using Patch() to update the figure template, you must use the figure template dict
1563
1564    template = BOOTSTRAP if switch_on else BOOTSTRAP_DARK
1565
1566    dark_theme = False if switch_on else True
1567
1568    old_fig = go.Figure(ex_fig)
1569
1570    old_fig = updateRefLinesTheme(old_fig, dark_theme)
1571
1572    patched_figure = Patch()
1573    patched_figure["layout"]["template"] = template
1574    patched_figure["data"] = old_fig["data"]
1575
1576    return patched_figure
1577
1578

1582@callback(
1583    Output(
1584        "start-mode",
1585        "data",
1586        allow_duplicate=True,
1587    ),
1588    Output(
1589        "start-ev-value",
1590        "data",
1591        allow_duplicate=True,
1592    ),
1593    Output(
1594        "end-ev-value",
1595        "data",
1596        allow_duplicate=True,
1597    ),
1598    Output(
1599        "ev-step-value",
1600        "data",
1601        allow_duplicate=True,
1602    ),
1603    Output(
1604        "time-step-value",
1605        "data",
1606        allow_duplicate=True,
1607    ),
1608    Output(
1609        "meas-passes-value",
1610        "data",
1611        allow_duplicate=True,
1612    ),
1613    Output(
1614        "batch-seq-dataframe",
1615        "data",
1616        allow_duplicate=True,
1617    ),
1618    Input("start-click", "n_clicks"),
1619    State("card-content", "children"),
1620    State("card-tabs", "active_tab"),
1621    State("start-ev-value", "data"),
1622    State("end-ev-value", "data"),
1623    State("ev-step-value", "data"),
1624    State("time-step-value", "data"),
1625    State("meas-passes-value", "data"),
1626    State("batch-seq-dataframe", "data"),
1627    prevent_initial_call=True,
1628)
1629def prepareForMeasurement(
1630    n: int,
1631    card_body: list,
1632    mode: str,
1633    start_ev: float,
1634    end_ev: float,
1635    ev_step: float,
1636    time_step: float,
1637    pass_no: int,
1638    batch_dataframe: dict,
1639) -> tuple[str, float, float, float, float, int, dict]:
1640    """Method called when the Start button is clicked.
1641
1642    Parameters
1643    ----------
1644    n : int
1645        The number of clicks of the Start button. Not used.
1646    card_body : list
1647        The list of child entries in the current active tab.
1648    mode : str
1649        The id of the current active tab.
1650    start_ev : float
1651        The start eV value from the Store.
1652    end_ev : float
1653        The end eV value from the Store.
1654    ev_step : float
1655        The step eV value from the Store.
1656    time_step : float
1657        The time per step value from the Store.
1658    pass_no : int
1659        The no. of passes value from the Store.
1660    batch_dataframe : dict
1661        The dict with the batch mode data grid from the Store.
1662
1663    Returns
1664    -------
1665    tuple[str, float, float, float, float, int, dict]
1666        Returns the current mode, start ev value, end ev value, step ev value, time per step value, no. of passes value, batch mode data grid, respectively, to the Store components.
1667    """
1668    if mode in "tab-2":
1669        dataframe = card_body[0]["props"]["children"][0]["props"]["data"]
1670        return (
1671            "batch",
1672            start_ev,
1673            end_ev,
1674            ev_step,
1675            time_step,
1676            pass_no,
1677            dataframe,
1678        )
1679    else:
1680        start_ev_mod = card_body[0]["props"]["children"][0]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1681        end_ev_mod = card_body[0]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1682        ev_step_mod = card_body[0]["props"]["children"][2]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1683        time_step_mod = card_body[0]["props"]["children"][3]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1684        pass_no_mod = card_body[0]["props"]["children"][4]["props"]["children"][1]["props"]["value"]
1685        return (
1686            "single",
1687            start_ev_mod,
1688            end_ev_mod,
1689            ev_step_mod,
1690            time_step_mod,
1691            pass_no_mod,
1692            batch_dataframe,
1693        )
1694
1695

1717
1718@callback(
1719    Output(
1720        "check-running",
1721        "data",
1722        allow_duplicate=True,
1723    ),
1724    Output(
1725        "interval-component",
1726        "disabled",
1727        allow_duplicate=True,
1728    ),
1729    Output(
1730        "progress-interval",
1731        "disabled",
1732        allow_duplicate=True,
1733    ),
1734    Output(
1735        "graph",
1736        "figure",
1737        allow_duplicate=True,
1738    ),
1739    Input("start-mode", "data"),
1740    State("start-ev-value", "data"),
1741    State("end-ev-value", "data"),
1742    State("ev-step-value", "data"),
1743    State("time-step-value", "data"),
1744    State("meas-passes-value", "data"),
1745    State("batch-seq-dataframe", "data"),
1746    State("source-select", "value"),
1747    State("switch", "value"),
1748    prevent_initial_call=True,
1749)
1750def startMeasurement(
1751    mode: str,
1752    start_ev: float,
1753    end_ev: float,
1754    ev_step: float,
1755    time_step: float,
1756    pass_no: int,
1757    batch_dataframe: dict,
1758    source_mg: bool,
1759    switch_on: bool,
1760) -> tuple[bool, bool, bool, go.Figure]:
1761    """Method called after the initial preparation of the measurement was done.
1762
1763    Parameters
1764    ----------
1765    mode : str
1766        String indicating if the mode of the measurement is single or batch mode.
1767    start_ev : float
1768        The start ev value to be used if a single mode measurement is selected.
1769    end_ev : float
1770        The end ev value to be used if a single mode measurement is selected.
1771    ev_step : float
1772        The step ev value to be used if a single mode measurement is selected.
1773    time_step : float
1774        The time per step value to be used if a single mode measurement is selected.
1775    pass_no : int
1776        The no. of passes value to be used if a single mode measurement is selected.
1777    batch_dataframe : dict
1778        The dictionary with the data from the batch data grid if the Batch mode measurement is selected.
1779    source_mg : bool
1780        Boolean indicating if the source of the X-Ray excitation is Mg.
1781    switch_on : bool
1782        Boolean indicating if the light mode theme is switched on.
1783
1784    Returns
1785    -------
1786    tuple[bool, bool, bool, plotly.graph_objects.Figure]
1787        Boolean indicating if the measurement is running, boolean if the interval-component is to be disabled, boolean if the progress-interval is to be disabled, the plotly Figure object, respectively.
1788    """
1789    batch_sett = pd.DataFrame(batch_dataframe)
1790    dark_theme = False if switch_on else True
1791    if mode in "single":
1792        data_backend.startMeasurement(start_ev, end_ev, ev_step, time_step, pass_no, batch_sett, source_mg)
1793        fig = reset_fig(theme_dark=dark_theme)
1794    else:
1795        data_backend.startMeasurement(start_ev, end_ev, ev_step, time_step, pass_no, batch_sett, source_mg, True)
1796        fig = reset_fig(theme_dark=dark_theme, batch_mode=True)
1797
1798    return True, False, False, fig
1799
1800
1801# ********************************************************************************
1802
1803
1804@callback(
1805    Output(
1806        "start-click",
1807        "disabled",
1808        allow_duplicate=True,
1809    ),
1810    Output(
1811        "stop-click",
1812        "disabled",
1813        allow_duplicate=True,
1814    ),
1815    Output(
1816        "shutdown-app",
1817        "disabled",
1818        allow_duplicate=True,
1819    ),
1820    Output("meas-select-card", "class_name"),
1821    Output(
1822        "interval-component",
1823        "disabled",
1824        allow_duplicate=True,
1825    ),
1826    Output(
1827        "save-results",
1828        "disabled",
1829        allow_duplicate=True,
1830    ),
1831    Output(
1832        "source-select",
1833        "disabled",
1834        allow_duplicate=True,
1835    ),
1836    Input("check-running", "data"),
1837    prevent_initial_call=True,
1838)
1839def checkRunningProgress(
1840    running: bool,
1841) -> tuple[bool, bool, bool, str, bool, bool, bool]:
1842    """Method called when the check-running boolean in the Store is updated.
1843
1844    Parameters
1845    ----------
1846    running : bool
1847        Boolean indicating if the measurement is running.
1848
1849    Returns
1850    -------
1851    tuple[bool, bool, bool, str, bool, bool, bool]
1852        The boolean indicating if the start button is disabled, boolean indicating if the stop button is disabled, boolean indicating if the shutdown button is disabled, the class name for the Card component, boolean indicating if the graph interval is disabled, boolean indicating if the save button is disabled, boolean indicating if the select source switch is disabled, respectively.
1853    """
1854    if running:
1855        return (
1856            True,  # disable the start button
1857            False,  # disable the stop button
1858            True,  # disable the shutdown button
1859            "mb-3 card-disable",  # class name for the Card component
1860            False,  # disable the graph interval component
1861            True,  # disable the save results button
1862            True,  # disable the source select switch
1863        )
1864    else:
1865        return (
1866            False,  # disable the start button
1867            True,  # disable the stop button
1868            False,  # disable the shutdown button
1869            "mb-3",  # class name for the Card component
1870            True if data_backend.meas_completed else False,  # disable the graph interval component
1871            False,  # disable the save results button
1872            False,  # disable the source select switch
1873        )
1874
1875
1876# ********************************************************************************
1877
1878
1879@callback(
1880    Output("progress-bar", "value"),
1881    Output("check-running", "data"),
1882    Output("kin-energy-disp", "value"),
1883    Output("binding-energy-disp", "value"),
1884    Output("time-elapsed-disp", "value"),
1885    Output("time-remain-disp", "value"),
1886    Input("progress-interval", "n_intervals"),
1887    prevent_initial_call=True,
1888)
1889def updateProgress(n: int) -> tuple[int, bool, float, float, float, float]:
1890    """Method called by the progress-interval interval component on firing.
1891
1892    Parameters
1893    ----------
1894    n : int
1895        Integer indicating the number of intervals the interval component was fired.
1896
1897    Returns
1898    -------
1899    tuple[int, bool, float, float, float, float]
1900        Integer for the current value of the progress bar, boolean indicating if the measurement is running, current kinetic energy value of the measurement, current binding energy value of the measurement, the elapsed time of the measurement, the remaining time of the measurement, respectively.
1901    """
1902    return (
1903        data_backend.current_progress,
1904        data_backend.meas_running,
1905        data_backend.current_kinetic_energy,
1906        data_backend.current_binding_energy,
1907        data_backend.elapsed_time,
1908        data_backend.remaining_time,
1909    )
1910
1911
1912# ********************************************************************************
1913
1914
1915@callback(
1916    Output(
1917        "graph",
1918        "figure",
1919        allow_duplicate=True,
1920    ),
1921    Output(
1922        "interval-component",
1923        "disabled",
1924        allow_duplicate=True,
1925    ),
1926    Input("interval-component", "n_intervals"),
1927    prevent_initial_call=True,
1928)
1929def updateGraphLive(n: int) -> tuple[Patch, bool]:
1930    """Method that is called in periodic intervals.
1931
1932    Parameters
1933    ----------
1934    n : int
1935        The iteration of the update interval.
1936
1937    Returns
1938    -------
1939    tuple[dash.Patch, bool]
1940        The patch for the figure object and the boolean indicating if the interval-component is to be disabled.
1941    """
1942    patched_figure = Patch()
1943    old_fig = data_backend.plot_fig
1944    data = old_fig.to_dict()["data"]
1945    patched_figure["data"] = data
1946
1947    return patched_figure, not data_backend.meas_running
1948
1949
1950# *********************************************************************************
1951
1952
1953@callback(
1954    Output(
1955        "modal",
1956        "is_open",
1957        allow_duplicate=True,
1958    ),
1959    Input("save-results", "n_clicks"),
1960    Input("cancel-save", "n_clicks"),
1961    State("modal", "is_open"),
1962    prevent_initial_call=True,
1963)
1964def confirmFileSaveModalOpen(n1: int, n2: int, is_open: bool) -> bool:
1965    """Method called when the Save results button is clicked. It will open a Modal to confirm the file save.
1966
1967    Parameters
1968    ----------
1969    n1 : int
1970        Integer holding the no. of clicks on the Save button.
1971    n2 : int
1972        Integer holding the number of clicks on the Cancel button in the Modal.
1973    is_open : bool
1974        Boolean indicating if the Modal is currently open.
1975
1976    Returns
1977    -------
1978    bool
1979        Boolean indicating if the Modal is to be opened.
1980    """
1981    if n1 or n2:
1982        return not is_open
1983    return is_open
1984
1985
1986# *********************************************************************************
1987
1988
1989@callback(
1990    Output("confirm-save", "disabled"),
1991    Output("save-as-file", "valid"),
1992    Output("save-as-file", "invalid"),
1993    Input("save-as-file", "value"),
1994    prevent_initial_call=True,
1995)
1996def checkFilenameValidity(filename: str) -> tuple[bool, bool, bool]:
1997    """Method to check filename validity.
1998
1999    Parameters
2000    ----------
2001    filename : str
2002        Name of the file to be saved as.
2003
2004    Returns
2005    -------
2006    tuple[bool, bool, bool]
2007        Boolean to disabled the save button in the modal, enable valid property of the input field, enable invalid property of the input field respectively.
2008    """
2009    pattern = r'[^.\\/:*?"\'<>|]+'
2010    match = re.fullmatch(pattern, filename)
2011    if match is not None:
2012        return False, True, False
2013    else:
2014        return True, False, True
2015    
2016# ********************************************************************************  
2017
2018
2019@callback(
2020    Output(
2021        "modal",
2022        "is_open",
2023        allow_duplicate=True,
2024    ),
2025    Input("confirm-save", "n_clicks"),
2026    State("graph", "figure"),
2027    State("save-as-file", "value"),
2028    prevent_initial_call=True,
2029)
2030def saveDataAndPlot(n_clicks: int, ex_fig: dict, filename: str) -> bool:
2031    """Method called when Save Results button is clicked.
2032
2033    Parameters
2034    ----------
2035    n_clicks : int
2036        Integer indicating the number of times the save-results button was clicked.
2037    ex_fig : dict
2038        The dictionary with the figure object of the graph area in the Dash app.
2039    filename : str
2040        The filename to save the results and plot as.
2041
2042    Returns
2043    -------
2044    bool
2045        The boolean to close the Modal.
2046    """
2047    old_fig = go.Figure(ex_fig)
2048    old_fig.write_html(
2049        filename + ".html",
2050        config=CONFIG,
2051        include_plotlyjs="cdn",
2052        include_mathjax="cdn",
2053    )
2054    data_backend.saveMeasurementData(filename)
2055    return False
2056
2057
2058# *********************************************************************************
2059
2060
2061@callback(
2062    Input("shutdown-app", "n_clicks"),
2063    prevent_initial_call=True,
2064)
2065def shutdownApp(n: int) -> None:
2066    """Method called when the shutdown-app button is clicked.
2067
2068    Parameters
2069    ----------
2070    n : int
2071        Integer indicating the number of times the shutdown-app button was clicked.
2072
2073    """
2074    data_backend.onClose()
2075

2083    waitress.serve(app.server, host="localhost", port="8060", expose_tracebacks=True, threads=8)
